# Draft:Peter F. Collier Awards for Ethics in Journalism

The Peter F. Collier Awards for Ethics in Journalism are annual awards granted to celebrate "acts of journalism by student and professional journalists that meet the highest ethical standards in the face of pressure or incentives to do otherwise."  They are administered by the Ethics and Journalism Initiative at the Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute at New York University.
The Collier Awards were established in 2024 by Nathan S. Collier, founder and chairman of the Collier Companies, in honor of his great grand uncle, publisher Peter F. Collier, founder of American general interest magazine, Collier's.
Prizes in 2024 were awarded in the following categories, with three awardees named for each:
* Exemplary ethical journalism by a high school, undergraduate, or graduate student journalist
* Exemplary ethical journalism with local or regional impact or significance by a professional journalist or team
* Exemplary ethical journalism with national or international impact or significance by a professional journalist or team
The Collier Awards judging panel selects awardees from journalistic work (print, digital, audio, video, and photographic) published between September 1 and August 31 of each year. The Collier Awards trophy is designed by Piotr Woronkowicz of London-based design firm Pentagram.
Recipients
These people and publications have been recognized as awardees of Peter F. Collier Awards for Ethics in Journalism.
Student Reporting
Garrett Shanley, University of Florida (2025)
Ariane Luthi, Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism (2025)
Cathy Wang, Johns Hopkins University (2025)
Local/Regional Reporting
Mississippi Today (2025)
The Baltimore Banner (2025)
Documented (2025)
National/International Reporting
The Washington Post (2025)
The New Yorker (2025)
The Guardian, International Consortium of Investigative Journalists, Arab Reporters for Investigative Journalism, NBC News (2025)
